attributes.action: Create a "halls" of residance for MPs in order to replace the need for any MP to have to claim for a second property in London whilst attending to paliamentary business
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In order to remove the need for any second homes in London for MPs to be able to attend parliamentary business we propose that the second home allowance be abolished and a "halls" type residence built to house all MPs.
This would then take away any ability for miss-use of expenses and after a period reduce costs.
As part of this proposal we would also propose that the immunity to capital gains tax for the sale of the 2nd home be taken away and any such tax be allocated to the cost of building/running the proposed "Halls"

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
